posts.cooked:
Blockquote ERROR ﻿﻿ -200 ﻿﻿ CTR: No new response to update signal ﻿﻿ Pigeon IMU 6 ConfigGetCustomParam ﻿﻿﻿ ﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ -200 ﻿﻿ CTR: No new response to update signal ﻿﻿ Pigeon IMU 6 ConfigFactoryDefault ﻿﻿﻿ ﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ 1 ﻿﻿ Unhandled exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot read the array length because “modulePositions” is null ﻿﻿ frc .robot.subsystems.Swerve.(Swerve.java:29) ﻿﻿﻿ ﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ 1 ﻿﻿ The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above. ﻿﻿ edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:365)

Blockquote

I take eror on driver station. pls help.
You’ve defined an array called modulePositions and somewhere in your code you try to read its length before initializing it with a value.

swerveOdometry = new SwerveDriveOdometry(Constants.Swerve.swerveKinematics, getYaw());

error is that line. How can i fix it?

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
That’s line 29 of your Swerve.java?

Also, as I said in one of your other posts, you really need to link to your code (and make sure its up to date) when asking for help with code problems
I use GitHub - frc3512/SwerveBot-2022: The source code for the 2022 FRC postseason swerve drive robot. .

link_counts.title: GitHub - frc3512/SwerveBot-2022: The source code for the 2022 FRC postseason swerve drive robot.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: “modulePositions” does not exist anywhere on the main branch of that repository.  So either you haven’t committed/pushed the latest changes to github, you’re working on a different branch (I dont see any others on github), or you haven’t deployed your most recent code to the robot so it’s erroring against old code.

posts.name: Chris Gerth
